meanings.definition: Enzymes that hydrolyze acetylcholine into choline and acetic acid.
meanings.sent1: Cholinesterases help break down acetylcholine in the body.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study cholinesterases to understand their role in neurotransmission.
meanings.sent3: The cholinesterases at the party were busy breaking down acetylcholine snacks.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was like the relentless action of cholinesterases on acetylcholine.
meanings.sent5: The classroom demonstration vividly showed how cholinesterases work on acetylcholine molecules.

meanings.definition: A type of enzyme that breaks down choline esters.
meanings.sent1: Cholinesterases play a crucial role in breaking down choline esters in the body.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained the function of cholinesterases in metabolizing choline esters.
meanings.sent3: The cholinesterases in the lab were joking about breaking down choline esters.
meanings.sent4: The cholinesterases worked tirelessly, like little cleaners, on the choline esters.
meanings.sent5: The smell of choline esters filled the room as the cholinesterases went to work.
